text: I was sitting in the office of Professor
androl pearson and it was the very
beginning of 2nd semester first year and
I wasn't very happy I came to school not
really sure of what i was doing here and
i think to come to business school you
have to have an objective and i was
young and most of my classmates were
older and maybe even a little a little
naive about some things and I just I
just wasn't happy and he looked at me
and we chatted for a few minutes and he
gave me a very inspirational talk and he
said importantly I want you to take a
deep breath and calm down because you're
way better than you think you are and
you need to believe in yourself so in
class next week I'm going to think about
when you really want to make a comment
and what you want to say and it can be
anytime in the class and even if we have
30 seconds to go in the class and you
have something important to say you just
raise your hand I'm going to call on you
this is a huge gift in a school where
participation is important and getting
in is important and getting cold called
can happen at any point and he told me
he wasn't going to cold call me and in
each class I raised my hand and I made a
comment and it was I'm not saying this
to be arrogant but it was a pivotal
comment in the class that day and him
giving me that opportunity gave me the
confidence to really fall in love with
business school and to really enjoy the
rest of my spring semester and the whole
second year and I'll never forget that
